info.description: Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) service providing RBAC-based access control. Supports both gRPC and REST API interfaces for seamless integration with client applications. Offers comprehensive user management, role-based permission control, and session accounting capabilities for secure system access.
info.title: AAA-Service API

get.description: Retrieves actions with optional filtering by ID or name and pagination support

post.description: Creates a new action with the provided details

400.description: Invalid request or missing required fields

put.description: Updates an existing action with the provided details

delete.description: Deletes an existing action by ID

post.description: Assigns a specified role to a user and returns the updated user details with roles and permissions
post.summary: Assign a role to a user

post.description: Handles the complete password reset flow in three steps: 1) Request OTP, 2) Verify OTP, 3) Reset password. Each step requires different request parameters.

200.description: Success responses vary by step: 1) 'OTP sent successfully', 2) 'OTP verified. Proceed to reset password.', 3) 'Password reset successfully'

post.description: Authenticates a user with username and password, returns JWT tokens in response headers and optional user details in body. If 'source: admin/panel' header is provided, only users with ADMIN, SUPER_ADMIN, or CUSTOMER_SUPPORT roles can login.

parameters.description: Access source (e.g., 'admin/panel' for admin panel access)
parameters.name: source

400.description: Invalid request body or missing credentials

403.description: Access Denied: Insufficient permission (when source=admin/panel but user lacks required role)

post.description: Creates a new user account with the provided details. Optionally sends OTP for Aadhaar verification if Aadhaar number is provided.

400.description: Invalid request body or validation failed

409.description: Username, mobile number or Aadhaar already exists

delete.description: Removes a specified role from a user and returns the updated user details with remaining roles and permissions
delete.summary: Remove a role from a user

get.description: Get resources with optional filtering by ID or name and pagination

post.description: Creates a new resource with the provided details

put.description: Updates an existing resource with the provided details

delete.description: Deletes an existing resource by ID

get.description: Retrieves roles with optional filtering by ID or name and pagination support

post.description: Creates a new role with associated permissions
post.summary: Create a new role with permissions

put.description: Updates an existing role and its permissions

delete.description: Deletes a role and all its associated permissions

post.description: Handles token transactions (credit/debit) or fetches token balance when no transaction type is specified

200.description: Returns remaining tokens in all cases" example({"remaining_tokens": 100})

400.description: Invalid request, insufficient tokens, or invalid transaction type

get.description: update schema by Retrieves all roles
Retrieves a list of users including their roles, permissions, and address information with optional pagination

500.description: Internal server error when fetching users or their details

get.description: Retrieves a single user's details including roles, permissions, and address information by their unique ID

500.description: Internal server error when fetching user or related data

put.description: Updates user information by ID. Only provided fields will be updated (partial update supported).

500.description: Failed to update user or fetch related data

data.description:
The actual data payload (can be any type)
@example {"id": 1, "name": "John Doe"}

error.description:
List of error messages (if any)
@example ["Invalid email format", "Password too short"]

message.description:
Human-readable message about the response
@example "Request processed successfully"

success.description:
Indicates if the request was successfully processed
@example true

timestamp.description:
Timestamp of when the response was generated
@example "2023-05-15T10:00:00Z"
